facts.text: On November 22, 1927, the Government of Madras issued a licence to the Bezwada (Vijayawada) Municipal Council under s. 3 of the Indian Electricity Act, 1910 for supply of electric energy within municipal limits at rates not exceeding maximum in third annexure.
Appellants, consumers of electric energy, entered into agreements with licensee agreeing to pay current official scale of rates. Ex. B-4 dated May 27, 1932 is one such agreement.
On December 13, 1940, Municipality passed resolution bringing new rates from April 1, 1940. Consumers paid these rates till 1956.
On April 30, 1956, Municipal Council passed resolution enhancing rates from 1-4-1956.
Appellants filed representative suit in District Munsif, Vijayawada for declaration that resolution dated April 30, 1956 was illegal and for injunction.
District Munsif held demand legal and dismissed suit.
Subordinate Judge held levy from date of resolution good but no retrospective operation; claim for duty at half an anna per unit invalid; modified decree.
Division Bench of Andhra Pradesh High Court confirmed Subordinate Judge's decree on October 10, 1961 in Second Appeal No. 872 of 1958.
Appeal by special leave to Supreme Court.

legal_issues.text: Whether rates agreed upon between consumers and Municipality can be unilaterally altered by resolution dated April 30, 1956, interpreting 'current official scale of rates' in agreements.
Whether resolution dated April 30, 1956 required previous sanction of State Government under s. 21(2) of the Indian Electricity Act, 1910.

petitioner_arguments.text: Rates agreed upon cannot be unilaterally altered and increased by Municipality; resolution dated April 30, 1956 invalid.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Clauses IV, V, X of agreement Ex. B-4

petitioner_arguments.text: Resolution passed without previous sanction of State Government under s. 21(2) of the Act, hence void.

respondent_arguments.text: s. 21(2) is general provision; s. 23 specific for rates, no sanction required. No alteration of conditions under para. IV of agreement.

court_reasoning.text: Words 'current official scale of rates' in para. IV mean official scale current or prevalent from time to time during currency of agreement, considering document as whole, surrounding circumstances, licence, ss. 22, 23, administrative practice.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Appellants contractually liable to pay enhanced rates.

court_reasoning.text: No alteration of condition under s. 21(2); term in para. IV continued to operate; change in rates in terms of condition, not derogation.

holdings.text: 'Current official scale of rates' means rates current from time to time; appellants liable to pay enhanced rates.
Enhancing rates does not alter condition under s. 21(2); no previous sanction required.

statutes_cited.name: Indian Electricity Act, 1910
statutes_cited.relevance: Licence issuance; conditions regulating relations with consumers; obligation to supply without discrimination; no sanction needed for rate enhancement as per interpretation.

outcome.summary: Appeal dismissed; resolution enhancing rates valid; appellants liable to pay enhanced rates from April 1, 1956 as per contractual obligation.

key_quotes.text: 'current official scale of rates' in para. IV of the agreement mean the official scale of rates current or prevalent from time to time during the currency of the agreement.
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: No sanction of the State Government was necessary for enhancing the rates.
key_quotes.speaker: court
